actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski with an amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 617.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
By Senator Murkowski from Committee on Energy and Natural Resources filed written report. Report No. 105-395.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on National Parks, Historic Preservation and Recreation

official_title: A bill to direct the Secretary of the Interior to study alternatives for establishing a national historic trail to commemorate and interpret the history of women's rights in the United States.
short_title: Women's Rights National Historic Trail Act of 1998
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Women's Rights National Historic Trail Act of 1998 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to study and report to specified congressional committees on alternatives for commemorating and interpreting the history of women's rights in the United States.

titles.title: Women's Rights National Historic Trail Act of 1998
Women's Rights National Historic Trail Act of 1998
Women's Rights National Historic Trail Act of 1998
A bill to direct the Secretary of the Interior to study alternatives for establishing a national historic trail to commemorate and interpret the history of women's rights in the United States.
